channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The drain seems to be sinking, the drain is in the road between no 14 and no 12 Everest Road GL539LG, 24th October
item.description:
The drain is outside no 12/14 on the Road it seems to be sinking see photo. Thanks Mark 07485037936

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Outside number 14 Everest Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole, 24th October
item.description:
On pottersfield road on the left just before no 10 - also general road surface in terrible condition all along pottersfield and apple tree close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pottersfield Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Tree roots, 24th October
item.description:
Tree roots growing through pavement outside number 50, causing damage and potential injury to people. They are also growing through the front garden of number 50

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by tree problem, 24th October
item.description:
Report ID: 8330001 Large tree fallen. Resting on smaller tree on main footpath to St Mary’s primary school on bouncers lane. Multiple children and parents at risks on school walk The smaller tree may be strong enough to hold the weight however it is not something I would want to risk given the large fitful on this pathway to the main estate that feeds a primary school.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface is damaged problem, 24th October
item.description:
Customer reports a deep pothole at the location, around 30 cm deep, which is covered by leaves. It is on a heavily-used section of footpath and they are concerned somebody will be injured as a consequence of walking/falling in to it - it is very dangerous.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -FW6 Potholes problem, 24th October
item.description:
Pothole FW in hours 2hr Emergency 300mm x 300mm x 120mm Give and take TM With Temporary FW Closure Use pinpoint Stats required Make safe with barriers Possible sink hole enquiry raised for AHR to investigate (FW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unstable flagstones outside 76-78 Promenade, 24th October
item.description:
On 21st Oct at approx 11.50 am, a lady fell and hit her head on the flagstones and was passed out. She was bleeding profusely and an ambulance had to be called. Thankfully we had a nurse on site. We need this looked at as multiple people on a daily basis are tripping and injuring themselves on those flagstones. we witness another lady on same day fell and busted her lip. Another gentleman fell on 23rd October.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence has become detached from fence posts and is falling over the path causing obstruction. This is a path well used by local walkers and school children., 24th October
item.description:
On the path near Robinswood cottages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the path opposite the Gables, 24th October
item.description:
Broken concrete cover leaving a gaping hole in the path. The path is very narrow at this point and the broken concrete cover, covers most of the width of the path Someone has stuck a bollard over the cover which blocks most of the path however this is better than someone putting a foot down the hole and breaking an ankle. This is extremely dangerous as no street lights in Shipton and it would be easy to miss the broken cover in the dark or trip over the bollard if still in place
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
